name: df-qpa
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(cqpa, cmpt(s0, cprime, csb(s1, cfv(cqp, cv(s0)), co(cv(s1), cpsl, cmpt(s2, cn, crab(s3, cfv(cpl1, cv(s1)), wa(wbr(co(cv(s1), cdg1, cv(s3)), cle, cv(s2)), wral(s4, crn(cfv(cco1, cv(s3))), wss(cima(ccnv(cv(s4)), cdif(cz, csn(nat0))), co(nat0, cfz, cv(s2)))))))))))
comment: Define the completion of the ` p ` -adic rationals. Here we simply define it as the splitting field of a dense sequence of polynomials (using as the ` n ` -th set the collection of polynomials with degree less than ` n ` and with coefficients ` < ( p ^ n ) ` ). Krasner's lemma will then show that all monic polynomials have splitting fields isomorphic to a sufficiently close Eisenstein polynomial from the list, and unramified extensions are generated by the polynomial ` x ^ ( p ^ n ) - x ` , which is in the list. Thus, every finite extension of ` Qp ` is a subfield of this field extension, so it is algebraically closed. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Dec-2014.)
